required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 5-year Study to Track Clinical Application of DecisionDx-Melanoma Gene Expression Profile Assay Results
clinical_study.official_title: An Ongoing, 5-year Post Market Study to Track Clinical Application of DecisionDx-Melanoma Gene Expression Profile (GEP) Assay Results and the Impact on Patient Outcomes and Health Economics

brief_summary.textblock:
The INTEGRATE Registry Study follows patients with cutaneous melanoma who have had the DecisionDx-Melanoma gene expression assay performed. Data will be collected through review of medical records from clinical visits with physician.
The purpose is to document the clinical application of results obtained from the DecisionDx- Melanoma multi-gene assay and to track outcomes of patients for whom DecisionDx-Melanoma testing has been completed. Additionally the study will assess the health economic impact of DecisionDx-Melanoma testing as it relates to the Melanoma population.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Study endpoints completed with lower than anticipated enrollment. Last patient enrolled completed final visit February 2021.

primary_outcome.time_frame: upon receipt DecisionDX-Melanoma results received and every 6 months thereafter
primary_outcome.description: Relaxed surveillance for the low risk group; Increased vigilance for early detection in the high risk group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Referral for sentinel lymph node interrogation in the high risk group in thin melanomas.
secondary_outcome.description: referral to SLNB in HR melanoma

other_outcome.measure: Early referral to medical oncologist for high risk patients.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with cutaneous melanoma for whom DecisionDx-Melanoma testing is to be clinically performed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients diagnosed with melanoma and determined, by their physician, to be appropriate for DecisionDx-Melanoma testing and who have successful results available to the investigator are eligible for registration
- Patients enrolled should be reasonably able to follow-up with the enrolling physician at regular intervals for assessment of outcome data.
- 16 Years and older
Exclusion Criteria:
- Less than 16 Years of age
